Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should abolish capital punishment", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Capital punishment has been proven ineffective in reducing crime rates.<sep>Keypoint: State-sanctioned killing is principally wrong
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that capital punishment has been proven ineffective in reducing crime rates.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: In places where capital punishment is legal, it is often used in discriminatory ways against minority groups, and therefore we should abolish it to prevent disproportionate punishment against the most vulnerable people in society.<sep>Keypoint: The death penalty harms the disenfranchised
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that in places where capital punishment is legal, it is often used in discriminatory ways against minority groups, and therefore we should abolish it to prevent disproportionate punishment against the most vulnerable people in society.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Capital punishment is irreversible, there are too many miscarriages of justice to justify retention of the penalty.<sep>Keypoint: The death penalty irreversible
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that capital punishment is irreversible, there are too many miscarriages of justice to justify retention of the penalty.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: There are some crimes so heinous, such as child rape and murder, that capital punishment is the only appropriate punishment for the crime as well as to act as a deterrent to others<sep>Keypoint: The death penalty prevents crimes
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that there are some crimes so heinous, such as child rape and murder, that capital punishment is the only appropriate punishment for the crime as well as to act as a deterrent to others

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Capital punishment provides permanent closure to victims and their families who have experienced immense trauma and have been subjected to intense pain by the criminal.<sep>Keypoint: The death penalty is acceptable in cases of severe crimes
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that capital punishment provides permanent closure to victims and their families who have experienced immense trauma and have been subjected to intense pain by the criminal.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Capital punishment is irreversible, there are too many miscarriages of justice to justify retention of the penalty.<sep>Keypoint: State-sanctioned killing is principally wrong
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that capital punishment is irreversible, there are too many miscarriages of justice to justify retention of the penalty.
